intro: Dracaena dentata, commonly known as the serrated dracaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear at the tips of its stems. Dracaena dentata is well adapted to low-light conditions and requires moderate watering to thrive. Its foliage makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
